text:
Albert is a city in Barton County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 175 people lived there.
History.
Albert was created in the early 1880s. It was named after Albert Kriesinger, a store owner. Albert was a station on the Great Bend and Scott part of the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway.
Geography.
Albert is at (38.453153, -99.012461). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 175 people, 77 households, and 58 families living in Albert.
